page.title: 09Bawdeswell Religion & Pop'n
page.content: There are 447 adults & 120 children, workers not employed locally commute to Dereham, Norwich, Swanton Morley and 3 travel to Lotus at Hethel. Of the children, 22 attend playgroup and fifty 5 to 11 year olds go to the village Primary School. Older children taken by coach to Reepham High School are educated to GCE O level standard. Many activities take place in the Village Hall, erected as a 1918 War Memorial and intended to last only 10 years! "The Reeves Tale", a duplicated magazine of Foxley and Bawdeswell, is delivered to each house every month. The Parish Church of All Saints was built in 1955 in Georgian style to replace one destroyed by a damaged RAF Mosquito aircraft during the 1939-45 War. There is also a Methodist Chapel, but the Gospel Hall has recently closed.
